title: Duncan James and new boyfriend approach milestone after First Dates Hotel
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Duncan James is preparing to reach a massive relationship milestone with his new boyfriend – he’s introducing him to his daughter for the first time.

Sitting down with Lorraine Kelly this morning, the Blue singer – who also enters First Dates Hotel tonight – shared the exciting news and was clearly beaming with joy.

The celeb’s partner, Rodrigo Ries, will be meeting 14-year-old Tianie-Finn James, whom James co-parents with former ballet dancer Claire Grainger.

Duncan is in a relationship with Rodrigo, who will meet the Blue star’s daughter this weekend (Picture: Instagram/Myles Goode)

‘Life is good,’ the Dancing on Ice contestant grinned. ‘I’m very happy and I’ve got [my daughter] this weekend. I’m introducing her to my fella for this weekend for the first time and that’s a big step as well.’

Although Duncan did admit that while the relationship is still in the ‘very early stages’, he still seemed completely besotted.

The singer has been dating the Brazilian-Belgian model since at least July this year – which is when Duncan started sharing snaps of his beau on social media.

In one post, taken from when the couple went on a holiday in the summer, the One Love hitmaker said that the positive response he got from pans upon uploading a loving snap made him ‘proud to be gay.’

Tonight, however, does see Duncan enter the First Dates Hotel, all in the aid of Stand Up to Cancer. Sitting with Lorraine this morning, Duncan admitted that the hunky potential partner we saw him sharing a meal with in a promo for tonight’s episode was ‘cute.’

While the chart-topper wouldn’t confirm or deny how his dinner date goes on the Channel 4 series goes tonight, he did say how visiting the dating resort was an invaluable experience for him, encouraging the star to be more open about his sexuality.

‘I’d never done anything like this before,’ he told Lorraine. ‘I always felt anxious about going out in front of the media with a partner. I got approached and got asked to do this for Stand Up to Cancer. I’m a huge fan of First Dates so to get to go to the hotel in Italy, I had to do it.’

Lorraine airs weekdays from 8.30am on ITV. First Dates Hotel airs tonight at 9pm on Channel 4.
